METS_Profile.title: E-ARK CS IP METS Profile 2.0
METS_Profile.abstract: This base profile describes the Common Specification for Information Packages (CS IP) and the implementation of METS for packaging OAIS conformant Information Packages. The profile is accompanied with a textuall document explaning the details of use of this profile. This will enable repository interoperability and assist in the management of the preservation of digital content. This profile is a base profile which is extended to E-ARK profiles for SIP, AIP and DIP. The profile can be used as is, but it is recommended that the supplied extending profiles are used. Alternatively, an own extension fulfilling the extending needs of the implementer can be created.
METS_Profile.related_profile: This profile has no related profiles

resource_model.head: Principles for a package conforming to the Common Specification for Information Packages (CS IP)

a.href: Link to the CS IP part with the description

note.p: An extension schema with the added attributes for use in this profile.
The schema is used with a namespace prefix of csip
A rule set for use with this profile is under development.

description_rules.p: The filepath must be decoded consistently throughout all file references within the information package.

vocabulary.name: Content information type specification name
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the specific E-ARK content information type names supported or maintained in this METS profile.

vocabulary.name: Content information type declaration
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the broad information type classification

vocabulary.name: OAIS Package type
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the OAIS type the package belongs to in the OAIS reference model.

vocabulary.name: Note type
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the type of a note for an agent.

vocabulary.name: Other agent type
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the other agent types supported by the profile
Describes the type of the identifier.

vocabulary.name: dmdSec status
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the status of the descriptive metadata section (dmdSec) which is supported by the profile.
Describes the mime type of a referenced file.

vocabulary.name: File group names
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the uses of the file group (fileGrp) that are supported by the profile.
Own names should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

vocabulary.name: Structural map typing
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the type of the structural map (structMap) that is supported by the profile.
Own types should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

vocabulary.name: Structural map label
vocabulary.URI: Link to XML-document with our vocabulary

description.p: Describes the label of the structural map that is supported by the profile.
Own labels should be placed in an own extending vocabulary.

description.head: Content Identification
description.p: It is mandatory to use a content ID which is expressed with @OBJID. The value should be the same as the name or ID of the package (the name of the root folder) for the root METS document or the name and folder name for the representation. The OBJID must meet the principle of being unique at least across the repository.

description.head: General content type
description.p: The @TYPE attribute must be used for identifying the general type of the package (genre). A vocabulary is used. The vocabulary is going to evolve under the care of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are developed.

description.head: Other general content type
description.p: The @csip:OTHERTYPE attribute must be used for stating the general type of the package (genre) when @TYPE has the value "OTHER"

description.head: Specific content type
description.p: An added attribute which describes the specific content information type specification used for the transferred content. The attribute is mandatory to use when the METS document describes a representation. The vocabulary is going to evolve under the care of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are developed.

description.head: Other specific content type
description.p: When the @csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE uses the value "OTHER" the @csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE must describe the content.

description.head: METS Profile
description.p: The PROFILE attribute has to have as its value the URL of the profile used for describing the package.

description.head: Package creation date
description.p: @CREATEDATE describes the date of creation of the package.

description.head: Package last modification date
description.p: @LASTMODDATE is mandatory if the package has been modified.

description.head: OAIS Package type information
description.p: @csip:OAISPACKAGETYPE is an attribute added by the CS IP for describing the type of the IP.

description.head: Agent
description.p: One mandatory agent is used to describe the software used for creating the package. Other uses of agents are described in the own implementations extending profile.

description.head: Agent role
description.p: The role of the mandatory agent is “CREATOR”.

description.head: Agent type
description.p: The type of the mandatory agent is “OTHER”.

description.head: Agent other type
description.p: The other type of the mandatory agent is “SOFTWARE”.

description.head: Agent name
description.p: The name of the mandatory agent is the name of the software tool which was used to create the IP.

description.head: Agent additional information
description.p: The mandatory agent has a note providing the version information for the tool which was used to create the IP.

description.head: Classification of the agent additional information
description.p: The mandatory agent note is typed with the fixed value of "SOFTWARE VERSION".

description.head: Descriptive metadata
description.p: Must be used if descriptive metadata for the package content is available. Each descriptive metadata section (dmdSec) contains one description and thus is repeated when more descriptions are available.
It is possible to transfer metadata in a package using just the descriptive metadata sectiond/or adminstrative metadata section.

description.head: Descriptive metadata identifier
description.p: An identifier for the descriptive metadata section (dmdSec) used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Descriptive metadata creation date
description.p: Creation date of the descriptive metadata in this section.

description.head: Status of the descriptive metadata
description.p: Status of the metadata. Used to indicate the currency of the package. If used the two values “SUPERSEDED” or “CURRENT” from the vocabulary is used.

description.head: Reference to the document with the descriptive metadata
description.p: Reference to the descriptive metadata file located in the “metadata” section of the IP.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the linked file. Values are taken from the list provided by the standard.

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type for the linked file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the linked file in bytes.

description.head: File creation date
description.p: The date the linked file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the linked file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: The type of checksum following the value list in the standard which used for the linked file.

description.head: Administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative / preservation metadata is available, it must be described using the administrative metadata section (amdSec) element.
It is possible to transfer metadata in a package using just the descriptive metadata sectiond/or adminstrative metadata section.

description.head: Digital provenance metadata
description.p: For recording information about preservation events the standard PREMIS is used. The PREMIS metadata must be either embedded or linked in a digital provenance metadata (digiprovMD) element. It is mandatory to include one digiprovMD element for each external PREMIS file placed in the “metadata/preservation” section, or for each embedded set of PREMIS metadata.

description.head: Digital provenance metadata identfier
description.p: An identifier for the digital provenance metadata section (digiprovMD) used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Status of the digital provenance metadata
description.p: Status of the metadata. Used to indicate the currency of the package. If used the two values “SUPERSEDED” or “CURRENT” from the vocabulary is used.

description.head: Reference to the document with the digital provenance metdata
description.p: Reference to the digital provenance metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. This specification recommends recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the linked file. Values are taken from the list provided by the standard.

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type for the linked file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the linked file in bytes.

description.head: File creation date
description.p: Date the linked file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the linked file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: The type of checksum following the value list in the standard which used for the linked file.

description.head: Rights metadata
description.p: For describing an overall access status for the package a simple rights statement may be used.

Standards possible to use includes RightsStatements.org used by Europeana (Europeana rights statements info), METS Rights Schema created and maintaned by the METS Board, the rights part of PREMIS as well as own local rights statements in use.

description.head: Rights metadata identifier
description.p: An identifier for the rights metadata section (rightsMD) used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Status of the rights metadata
description.p: Status of the metadata. Used to indicate the currency of the package. If used the two values “SUPERSEDED” or “CURRENT” from the vocabulary is used.

description.head: Reference to the document with the rights metadata
description.p: Reference to the rights metadata file stored in the “metadata” section of the IP.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of metadata
description.p: Specifies the type of metadata in the linked file. Value is taken from the list provided by the standard.

description.head: File mime type
description.p: The IANA mime type for the linked file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the linked file in bytes.

description.head: File creation date
description.p: Date the linked file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the linked file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: The type of checksum following the value list in the standard which used for the linked file.

description.head: File section
description.p: When the section is used only one file section (fileSec) element is present.
It is possible to transfer just descriptive metadata and/or adminsitrative metadata without files placed in this section.

description.head: File section identfier
description.p: An identifier for the file section used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: File grouping
description.p: There are one or more file group (fileGrp) elements present grouping the transfered files in the main catagorization of; Documentation, Schemas and Representations.
In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Documentation" all documetation pertaining to the transfered information is present.
In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Schemas" all XML-schemas pertaining to the transfered XML documents is present.
In one or more file groups with the catagorization of "Representations" the data being transfered is present or in one file group the data for each representation is present.
To make the catagorization easier the different files being transfered should be placed in folders with names folowing the catagorization

description.head: Reference to administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata is has been provided on the file group (fileGrp) level this attribute points to the correct administrative metadata section.

description.head: Specific content type
description.p: An added attribute which describes the specific content information type specification used for the transferred content. The attribute is mandatory to use when the file group catagorization is Representations. The vocabulary is going to evolve under the care of the DILCIS Board as additional content information type specifications are developed.

description.head: Other specific content type
description.p: When the @csip:CONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE uses the value "OTHER" the @csip:OTHERCONTENTINFORMATIONTYPE must describe the content.

description.head: Description of the use of the file group
description.p: The value in the @USE is the name of the whole folder structure to the data, e.g "Documentation", "Schemas", "Representations/preingest" or "Representations/submission/data"

description.head: File group identifier
description.p: An identifier for the file group used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: File
description.p: The lowest level file group (fileGrp) contains the file elements which describe the transferred file objects.
When the file element is categorised as "Representations" each representation file group contains one file which is the reference to the METS document describing the representation

description.head: File identifier
description.p: A unique identifier for this file across the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: File mimetype
description.p: The IANA mime type for the linked file.

description.head: File size
description.p: Size of the linked file in bytes.

description.head: File creation date
description.p: Date the linked file was created.

description.head: File checksum
description.p: The checksum of the linked file.

description.head: File checksum type
description.p: The type of checksum following the value list in the standard which used for the linked file.

description.head: File original identfication
description.p: If an original ID for the file has been given by the owner it can be saved in this attribute.

description.head: File reference to administrative metadata
description.p: If administrative metadata has been described for the file this attribute points to the file's administrative metadata.

description.head: File reference to descriptive metadata
description.p: If descriptive metadata has been described per file this attribute points to the file's descriptive metadata.

description.head: File locator reference
description.p: The location of each external file must be defined by the file location (FLocat) element using the same rules as for referencing metadata files. All references to files should be made using the XLink href attribute and the file protocol using the relative location of the file.

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Structural description of the package
description.p: Each METS file must include ONE structural map (structMap) element used exactly as described here. Institutions can add their own additional custom structural maps as separate structMap sections.

description.head: Type of structural description
description.p: The type attribute of the structural map (structMap) is set to value “PHYSICAL” from the vocabualry.

description.head: Name of the structural description
description.p: The label attribute is set to value “CS IP StructMap” from the vocabulary.

description.head: Structural description identifier
description.p: An identifier for the structural description (structMap) used for referencing inside the package. It must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Main structural division
description.p: The structural map consist of one main division.

description.head: Main division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Main structural division label
description.p: The main division (div) element in the package uses the package ID as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: Sub structural division
description.p: Each catagorization "Documentation", "Schemas" as well as each "Representation" within the package must be represented by an occurrence of the division (div) element.
Metadata in the administrative and descriptive metadata section has its own division

description.head: Metadata division
description.p: The metadata referenced in the administrative and/or descriptive metadata section is described in the structural map with one sub division
When the transfer consist of only administrative and/or descriptive metadata this is the only sub division that occurs

description.head: Metadata division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata"

description.head: Metadata division label
description.p: The metadata division (div) element in the package uses the value "Metadata" as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: Metadata division administrativ metadata referencing
description.p: All administrative metadata described in the package are referenced via the administrative sections different identifiers.

description.head: Metadata division descriptive metadata referencing
description.p: All descriptive metadata described in the package are referenced via the descriptive section identifiers.

description.head: Documentation division
description.p: The documentation referenced in the file section file groups is described in the structural map with one sub division

description.head: Documentation division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

description.head: Documentation division label
description.p: The documentation division (div) element in the package uses the value "Documentation" as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: Documentation file referencing
description.p: All file groups containg documentation described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers.

description.head: Schema division
description.p: The schemas referenced in the file section file groups is described in the structural map with one sub division

description.head: Schema division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

description.head: Schema division label
description.p: The schema division (div) element in the package uses the value "Schemas" as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: Schema file referencing
description.p: All file groups containg schemas described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifiers.

description.head: File division
description.p: When the transfer consist of only data and no representations there are one representation div present
The transfered files referenced in the file section file group is described in the structural map with one sub division

description.head: File division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

description.head: File division label
description.p: The file division (div) element in the package uses the value "Representations" as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: File division file referencing
description.p: The file group containing the files described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifier.

description.head: Representation divisions
description.p: When the transfer consist of representations there are one representation div present for each representation

description.head: Representation division identifier
description.p: Mandatory, identifier must be unique within the package.
The ID must follow the rules for xml:id described in the chapter of the textual description of CS IP named "General requirements for the use of metadata".

description.head: Representation division label
description.p: The representation division (div) element in the package uses the path to the METS document as the value for the attribute LABEL.

description.head: Representations division file referencing
description.p: The file group containing the files described in the package are referenced via the relevant file group identifier.

description.head: Representation METS pointer
description.p: The division (div) of the specific representation includes one occurrence of the METS pointer (mptr) element, pointing to the appropriate representation METS file.

description.head: Resource location
description.p: The actual location of the resource. We recommend recording a URL type filepath within this attribute.

description.head: Type of link
description.p: Attribute used with the value “simple”. Value list is maintained by the xlink standard

description.head: Type of locator
description.p: The locator type is always used with the value "URL" from the vocabulary in the attribute.

description.head: structLink
description.p: Section not defined or used in CS IP, additional own uses may occur.

description.head: behaviorSec
description.p: Section not defined or used in CS IP, additional own uses may occur.
What the tool does.
What the tool does.
What the tool does.
